Welcome to Technodysis Private Limited!
With reference to your application and subsequent interview with us for a career in our organization, we are pleased to inform you that you have been selected for employment in our organization as . We take this opportunity to thank and appreciate your decision to join Technodysis Private Limited and requested to join us on .
We will be shortly arranging an introductory session to you. The date and time will be communicated by our HR Department in a separate communication. We expect that this session will provide you with an overview of our organization, its policies, practices and career opportunities during your career with us. Much more than that, this session will be a platform for us to get into a common understanding on your roles and responsibilities and expectations so that your tenure in the organization can create immense value. We look forward to a long-term relationship in a mutually rewarding way.
Best Wishes,
For Technodysis Private Limited,
Note: This offer of appointment is subjected to successful completion of the joining formalities and also any associated background verification processes.

Dear ,
We are pleased to appoint you as in Technodysis Private Limited. This appointment is subject to you joining the organization and on the basis of following terms. Please note that the employment terms are as per the policies of the organization.
The effective date of your appointment will be .
1. APPOINTMENT
a. Your date of appointment is effective from , unless otherwise a formal communication from the organization.
b. Validity of this offer of appointment is subject to your successful submission and verification of personal, academic, experiential or any other relevant documentation that organization feels essential for ensuring the integrity and authenticity of the information furnished to the organization. Organization at its discretion can take up the background verification of all such information/documents submitted.
2. COMPENSATION
Your compensation during the employment will be as follows;
a. Basic salary of Rs. per annum.
b. Variable pay of Rs. per annum
Refer Annexure 1 for the complete information on your salary breakup and other benefits. Kindly note that
c. Your salary will be reviewed periodically as per the organization’s policies.
d. Any possible changes in your salary are subject to the discretion of the organization and also will be based on your contributions to the organization in the form of performance and results.
3. OTHER BENEFITS
You shall be eligible for other benefits related to leaves, perquisites, etc., in accordance with the statutory norms and prevailing terms of employment in the organization. Company reserves the right to change these benefits as and when it deems necessary and will be published accordingly. Some of the notable benefits may be;
a. Leaves, holidays and working hours as applicable to your role, location and client’s policies if applicable
b. Perquisites, if any, as applicable to your role
c. Applicable Allowances for assignment specific relocation as per the policy
d. ESI or Medical Insurance as applicable, gratuity plan, survivor benefit plan and industrial injury benefits as per the policy
4. PROBATION
a. You will be on probation for a period of six (6) months from the date of your appointment. On completion of the probationary period, your appointment shall be confirmed and communicated to you in writing if the Company finds you to be suitable for the appointed post. Unless confirmation is communicated in writing, your probation period is deemed extended.
b. A probationary period is considered to be a phase where employee will be undergoing skill orientation activities, role specific knowledge gaining activities and enablement for the role. During this phase organization may also plan for any trainings/certifications. All such initiatives are considered as future readiness of the employee. Hence, any decisions of separation in the form of resignation during this period will be considered to be causing business, financial and reputational losses to the organization. Hence, in any such situations where losses are incurred, the organization may decide to recover such losses from the employee, which might be determined on case to case basis.
In an event that you are on a sponsored dedicated training by Technodysis, any exit for a period of six months also attracts the estimated cost of such trainings, applicable certification costs, etc., to be recovered from the candidate. This is applicable during the probationary period only.
5. GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT
During your employment with Technodysis, you may have to perform responsibilities in a diverse set of conditions such as but not limited to as below.
a. Technodysis may at any given point of time, opt to transfer to any other branch, location, division or its subsidiary, etc., In such a situation, the terms and conditions of service applicable to the new assignment govern you.
b. Technodysis may at any given point of time, opt to deploy you to a customer location as per the customer requirement.
c. Our official working hours are from 8.30 AM to 6.00 PM, with a lunch break of 45 minutes at 1.00 PM. However, the working hours are totally determined by the applicable working hours of the assignment, which can be even working in shifts or week-ends. You may be required to operate from any of these locations and in any of the shifts, including night shift, as may be required, keeping in view the business needs.
d. You may be required to sign necessary agreements with the Company or client as required and complete various formalities as per the agreements at the time of joining and during the tenure with the company. Your offer will be valid based on client’s project requirements/work order.
e. You will devote yourself exclusively to the business of the Company. You will not take up any other work for remuneration (part time or otherwise) or work on advisory capacity or be interested directly or indirectly (except as shareholder or debenture holder) in any other trade or business during your employment with the Company, without written permission from the Company.
f. In consideration of your position, you must effectively, diligently and to the best of your ability perform all responsibilities and ensure that results are achieved as expected. This may demand working extra hours to achieve the above whenever the job so requires.
g. Socially, you must not engage in activities that have or will have an adverse impact on the reputation / image and business of Technodysis, whether directly or indirectly. You need to ensure that your presentation on any social media platforms is in the best interest of organization and the applicable legal framework of the Geography/Country of presence.
h. You will be required to undertake travel on Company work for which you will be reimbursed travel expenses as per the Company policy applicable to you.
i. We, at Technodysis are committed to ensure 'Integrity' in all aspects of its functioning. You are expected to comply with the policies of the company including the Information Security Policy and other policies as they form an integral part of the terms of employment with Technodysis. Consequently, you are required to understand the scope and intent behind these policies and to comply with the same. These policies are updated / modified on a periodic basis and new policies may be introduced from time to time. As and when this happens, the Company will notify you and you will be required to comply with the same.
j. In connection with your employment and during the term of your employment you shall disclose and assign to Technodysis as its exclusive property, all developments developed or conceived by you solely or jointly with others and shall comply with the policies of the Company in relation to Intellectual Property.
6. CONFLICT OF INTEREST
You need to understand that indulging in activities as mentioned below results in conflict of interest and always you should avoid such engagements.
a. During your employment, you are required to engage with organization’s assignment fully.
b. You will not seek full time or part time job or be involved in any way with competitor’s business activities either directly or indirectly during your employment with the Company
c. For a period of one year from the date of termination of your employment, you would not engage in influencing any other employees or contacts at the customer location in any manner such as termination of employment, any business engagements, etc.,
7. CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION
Except legal obligation, you will not disclose any kind of information to public or anyone outside the organization. In such cases you will be responsible for financial loss and legal issues.
a. In consideration of the opportunities, training and access to new techniques and know-how that will be made available to you, you will be required to comply with the confidentiality policy of the company. Therefore, please ensure that you maintain as secret and confidential all Confidential Information and shall not use or divulge or disclose any such Confidential Information except as may be required under obligation of law or as may be required by Technodysis and in the course of your employment. This covenant shall endure during your employment and for a period of one year from the cessation of your employment with Technodysis (irrespective of the circumstances or the reasons for cessation).
b. During your employment with Technodysis, you will be expected not to use or disclose any confidential information, including trade secrets, of any former employer or other person with whom you have an obligation of confidentiality and by signing below you affirm that you have no conflicting obligations or non-compete agreements that would prevent you from working without limitation for Technodysis.
8. SEPARATION
Separation from employment can happen due to various reasons;
a. The retirement age in our organization is 58 years. Upon successful service of an employee on completion of 58 years separation from active service of the organization comes into effect.
b. Your employment with the organization can also be terminated either by the Company or by you by giving the other party ‘One Month’ notice. For successful completion of notice period you are required to comply with the separation process.
c. A separation that might take place due to any possible acts by an employee which qualify for instant separation such as policy related violations, integrity issues, background verification failure, inability to comply to the needs of the customer, etc., In all such situations, you shall comply with the Company’s termination procedures, sign all documents and return all Company/Clients property.
In an adverse situation of unclean separation, company is not liable to pay any dues to employee.
9. GENERAL
a. We trust that you have not provided us with any false declaration or wilfully suppressed any material information. If you have, you will be liable for removal from service without notice. Please note that you are required to inform us if there are any agreements, oral or written, which you have entered into and which relate to your commitments under this Agreement.
b. Your employment terms may be specifically enforced legally, if required. In this connection, if any of the provisions of this Agreement are declared or found to be void or unenforceable due to any reason whatsoever, the remaining provisions of this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect.
c. These employment terms supersede and replace any existing agreement or understanding, if any, between Technodysis and you relating to the same subject matter.
d. You warrant that you are not prevented by a court or by any other administrative or judicial order from providing the services required under this agreement. In the event that you are not a citizen of the country of posting, you should have a valid work permit to work in the country of posting.
